intro: Cochranea sentis, commonly known as the sensitive cochranea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its sensitivity to environmental changes, it is often considered an indicator species for ecosystem health.
